title: Detect what app uses a comport - potentially for a vmware escape via a comport/named pipe ntoskrnl
content:
How could I diagnose if this named pipe that goes to com1 in vmware (now to a txt file) is malware or a legitimate piece of software?

Are there anyways to track what sends data to a comport in windows 10

The named pipe is sending things like this

SystemRoot\system32\ntoskrnl.exeNULÂª0000BELNULDC2SOHNULBS... lots more

Lots of NULs and padding (I won't include the full txt as it might have identifying information in there)

'omitted' KDTARGET: Refreshing KD connection 'omitted' KDTARGET: Refreshing KD connection

Detecting what is opening the named pipe/comport on windows startup would likely be all I need to determine the answer to this.

Some background info here on windows kernel debugging using https://voidsec.com/windows-drivers-reverse-engineering-methodology/
